name: aws-vault
description: Securely store and access AWS credentials in development environments

repo.name: aws-vault
repo.description: A vault for securely storing and accessing AWS credentials in development environments

readme.summary: The README provides a clear and concise introduction to the package, with good installation instructions and examples, but lacks comprehensive troubleshooting documentation.

injection_risks.description: The use of exec.Command with user-controlled input can lead to command injection attacks
The use of exec.Command with user-controlled input can lead to command injection attacks
The use of exec.Command with user-controlled input can lead to command injection attacks

critical_findings: Command injection risks in server/ec2alias_bsd.go, server/ec2alias_linux.go, and server/ec2alias_windows.go
Lack of validation for environment variables in contrib/_aws-vault-proxy/main.go
security.summary: The code has several security concerns, including command injection risks, lack of input validation, and potential error exposure, which need to be addressed to ensure the security of the application.

sentiment.summary: The aws-vault community is actively engaged, with maintainers responding to issues and users seeking help with configuration and performance problems.

communication.summary: The maintainer's responses are generally helpful, clear, patient, and welcoming, but could benefit from providing more technical depth in their explanations.

positive_signals: High number of commits in the past 6 months (328)

Multiple active contributors in the past 6 months (9)
maintenance.summary: The aws-vault package appears to be actively maintained with frequent updates, a high volume of pull requests, and multiple recent contributors.
